Executive Summary

EPA Risk Management Program Executive Summary



1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



Flexitank, Inc. is a privately held, logistics company located in Guaynabo, Puerto Rico we are committed to operating and maintaining all of our processes related to bulk chemical transportation and storage in a safe and responsible manner. Flexitank complies with applicable federal, state and local regulations. All Flexitank employees are informed of hazards in the workplace and are trained accordingly. Flexitank has procedures in place in the facility, in the unlikely event that hazardous substance releases were to occur, which activates emergency notification and response procedures to ensure the safety of our employees, the community, the environment and property.



2. Facility and Regulated Substances



Flexitank is an NVOCC (OTI) that specializes in logistics management. We occasionally store ISO-tanks containing chemical products for our customers as an "added value" service in our Depot Facilities located on the Zona Portuaria in San Juan.  

Flexitank Depot receives the bulk liquid cargo by the following modes of transportation: tank trucks, ISO tank containers and flexi-bags (no hazardous products only). The received cargo is stored on-site according to customer-specified requirements, and it is subsequently dispatch on the same transportation modes as originally received. Flexitank, Inc. does not perform any chemical processing, manufacturing nor does product is transferred to intermediate storage containers. 



The following Regulated Toxic Substances are occasionally stored at Flexitank, Depot facilities and have been identified by the EPA as having the potential to cause significant consequences in the event of a substantial accidental release: 



Anhydrous Ammonia (CAS Number 7664-41-7)



Our Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) which includes, but are not limited to; Emergency response and contingency plans and t

raining programs, in combination with our "on-site" emergency response HAZMAT team help us effectively manage and minimized the potential hazards posed to our employees, the community, and the environment. 

3. Worst-Case and Alternate-Case Release Scenarios



Please reference onsite data (Risk Management Plan) at Flexitank's facility.



4. General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Ammonia Specific Prevention



Flexitank, Inc. is process of reaching compliance for program 3 of the RMP and OSHA Process Safety Management for Highly Hazardous Chemicals (PSM) standard relative to anhydrous ammonia. Therefore, this facility has programs to ensure proper operation and maintenance of the ammonia ISO-tanks. ISO-tanks are considered portable tanks; they are designed and constructed using IMO and CFR 49 172.101 "T"- codes to conform to industry standards. Regulatory inspections of these tanks are performed accordingly, and a "per trip" preventive maintenance program is in place to ensure ongoing system integrity and to minimize release incidents. All employees associated with this facility operation have been trained and are knowledgeable in the safe operation of ISO tanks and emergency response procedures in case of a release. 



5. Five Year Accident History

During the past five (5) years there have been no accidental releases from RMP covered processes at the Flexitank Depot or off site which resulted in death, injuries, or significant property or environmental damages.



All incidents and releases, on site or off site, are formally investigated as part of our facility's QHSSE program to identify corrective and preventive actions for continuous process improvement.
